IT Act, 2000 Cases

Cyber Law Enforcement

Information Technology Act, 2000 - Case Management

The Information Technology Act, 2000 is the primary law in India dealing with cybercrime and electronic commerce. Maharashtra's GAD-IT department plays a crucial role in implementing and enforcing this legislation across the state.

📋

Active Cases
+15% this month
✅
3,892
Resolved Cases
+8% this month

Case Categories Under IT Act, 2000

Cyber Fraud & Financial Crimes

Online banking fraud, credit card scams, UPI fraud, and digital payment related crimes.

1,892 cases Section 66C, 66D
View Cases

Data Theft & Privacy Violations

Unauthorized access to personal data, identity theft, and privacy breaches.

987 cases Section 43A, 72A
View Cases

Cyber Harassment & Stalking

Online harassment, cyberstalking, morphing, and defamation through digital means.

756 cases Section 66A, 67
View Cases

Hacking & Unauthorized Access

Computer hacking, website defacement, and unauthorized system access.

543 cases Section 66, 70
View Cases

Digital Signature & Document Forgery

Forged digital signatures, fake certificates, and document manipulation.

234 cases Section 71, 73
View Cases

Obscene & Offensive Content

Publishing obscene content, child pornography, and offensive material online.

183 cases Section 67, 67B
View Cases

IT Act Case Investigation Process

1

Complaint Registration

Victim files complaint online or at cyber crime police station with evidence and documentation.

Duration: 1-2 days
2

Initial Investigation

Police verify complaint, collect digital evidence, and determine applicable sections under IT Act.

Duration: 7-15 days
3

Digital Forensics

Technical analysis of digital evidence, data recovery, and forensic examination by experts.

Duration: 15-30 days
4

Legal Proceedings

Chargesheet filing, court proceedings, and final judgment based on evidence and investigation.

Duration: 6-18 months
